sourcesContent:
export const projectsList = [
  {
    id: "gridiron-gauntlet",
    title: "Gridiron Gauntlet",
    subtitle: "Game Design, Gesture Recognition, Collision Detection",
    link: "https://bit.ly/gridirongauntlet",
    textList: [
      "Software Methods final project.",
      "Single player iOS clone of the Super Mario Party game, Gridiron Gauntlet. The player must avoid colliding with time-scaled moving enemies within the game board bounds for as long as possible.",
      "Swift/Xcode, SpriteKit, UIKit, GameplayKit, CoreGraphics",
    ],
  },
  {
    id: "pin",
    title: "PIN‽",
    subtitle: "User Experience, Design, User Testing",
    link: "https://bit.ly/pindocs",
    textList: [
      "Human-Computer Interaction final project.",
      "Encourages users to be curious via location-based information crowdsourcing.",
      "Balsamiq, Markdown, Git, contextual inquiry, paper and digital prototypes, user testing",
    ],
  },
  {
    id: "cornell-box-2",
    title: "Cornell Box 2",
    subtitle: "3D Graphics, Camera Controls, Transformations",
    link: "https://github.com/AlyssaWang/GraphicsPracticals2",
    textList: [
      "Computer Graphics final project (2/2).",
      "Created a rotating cube with a bespoke transformation system and user-controlled camera built in WebGL.",
      "JavaScript, HTML/CSS, WebGL, linear algebra",
    ],
  },
  {
    id: "cornell-box-1",
    title: "Cornell Box 1",
    subtitle: "3D Graphics, Camera Controls, Transformations",
    link: "https://github.com/AlyssaWang/GraphicsPracticals",
    textList: [
      "Computer Graphics final project (1/2).",
      "Created a Cornell box featuring a rotating and bouncing sphere and cube with shadows, lighting, collision detection, and user-controlled camera in three.js.",
      "JavaScript, HTML/CSS, three.js, linear algebra",
    ],
  },
  {
    id: "temperature-gloves",
    title: "Temperature Gloves",
    subtitle: "Internet of Things, Wearable Technologies, Circuit Design/Construction",
    textList: [
      "eTextiles final project.",
      "Programmed a pair of gloves to indicate temperature via LED gradient to inform the user whether to remove their gloves.",
      "LilyPad Arduino, sensors, circuits, conductive fabrics, embroidery",
    ],
  },
  {
    id: "reqtrak",
    title: "ReqTrak",
    subtitle: "User Accounts, Web Scraping, Data Store",
    link: "https://bit.ly/ReqTrak",
    textList: [
      "EphHacks Best Execution Winner.",
      "Provides a centralized platform to help Williams College students keep track of which criteria they have completed/yet to complete in order to satisfy their major requirements.",
      "Prompts a user for a secure login, then maintains a persistent checklist of requirements for their chosen major.",
      "Javascript, Python, HTML/CSS, Google App Engine, Google OAuth",
    ],
  },
];
